definitions.text: the act of gripping and pressing firmly
examples: he gave her cheek a playful squeeze

definitions.text: a state in which there is a short supply of cash to lend to businesses and consumers and interest rates are high
a situation in which increased costs cannot be passed on to the customer
examples: increased expenses put a squeeze on profits
she was his main squeeze
gave the wet cloth a wring

definitions.text: an aggressive attempt to compel acquiescence by the concentration or manipulation of power
examples: she laughed at this sexual power play and walked away
come here and give me a big hug

definitions.text: the act of forcing yourself (or being forced) into or through a restricted space
examples: getting through that small opening was a tight squeeze

definitions.text: to compress with violence, out of natural shape or condition
examples: crush an aluminum can
squeeze a lemon
He squeezed my hand

definitions.text: squeeze like a wedge into a tight space
examples: I squeezed myself into the corner

definitions.text: to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means :
examples: She forced him to take a job in the city
He squeezed her for information
They extorted money from the executive by threatening to reveal his past to the company boss
They squeezed money from the owner of the business by threatening him
Stuff money into an envelope
She thrust the letter into his hand
He pinched her behind
She squeezed the bottle

definitions.text: squeeze (someone) tightly in your arms, usually with fondness
examples: Hug me, please
They embraced
He hugged her close to him
she compressed her lips
the spasm contracted the muscle
